result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner L. Raymond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara County Case No. 13CF102

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with M. Bielmeier and/or A. Lopez directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara County Case No. 13CF102

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanner L. Raymond

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

13CF-102 and 14CF-207 - Cases Called @ 1:30 PM: Defendant Tanner L. Raymond in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Def facing significant charges in Portage Co - offer extended from Waushara Co DA.  Def does wish to proceed today to plea.  14CF-207:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.   Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  DA outlines resolution for Court.  Court questions Def as to proceeding today.  Def states he wishes to proceed today and will accept offer.  Court will honor Def's request to go forward today.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 w/o Repeater Enh: NC.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Repeater component attached to this charge dismissed outright.  Sentencing on both matters will proceed today based upon Def's request.  Argument by DA.  Argues for 30 mos IC/30 Mos ES for a period of 5 yrs with 238 TS credit as calculated.  Each case with concurrent terms.  Any outstanding Rest unpaid requests entry of civil judgment - J/S obligation.  No Contact with 14CF-207 victim M. Bielmeier and A. Lopez.  AODA and any follow thru, Costs.  State believes that firearm has been recovered and may be returned to victim.  Argument by SPD:  Requests court follow State's recommendation.  No statement offered by Def.  The Court:  Limited information at Court's disposal today to consider.  Probationary sentence not an option and would unduly depreciate the severity of what has happened.  Recommendation is accepted and imposes same.  13CF-102 - 5 yr term of imprisonment - 30 mos IC/30 mos ES - 238 Days TS credit.  Rest owed of $1550.65 be reduced to civil judgment that will be in favor of M. Goble.  Extent to which payment has been made would reduce amount owed.  Costs reimposed.  14CF-207:  5 yr term of imprisonment concurrent to 13CF-102.  Conditions:  30 mos IC/30 mos ES - no TS credit against this sentence.  Conditions of ES:  Complete AODA, Ab Sob, Not to possess any impairing substances unless prescribed by a physician;  No contact wit M. Bielmeier and/or A Lopez.  Court Costs to include DNA Surcharge. Same terms of ES to be ordered.  Def found eligible for  both CIP and SARP - however based upon Portage Co charging Def will more than likely not be eligible.  Eligible for Waushara Co cases however.  Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus
